intro: Fimbristylis complanata var. subaphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved flatsedge, is a grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, flat leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in coastal areas or along waterways. Its botanical structure makes it well-adapted to moist soils and high humidity conditions.
